definition: to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)

sentences.chinese: 他的优良品行值得称赞。

sentences.english: She was acclaimed by many peoples because her artlessness.
sentences.chinese: 她的朴实得到了许多人的称赞。

sentences.english: He commended them for their enthusiasm.
Very few people get that kind of praise from Eunice .
sentences.chinese: 很少有人能从她那里得到这样的称赞。

sentences.english: Set me free from my prison, that I may praise your name.
sentences.chinese: 求你领我出离被囚之地，我好称赞你的名。

sentences.english: When did you last pay them a compliment?
sentences.chinese: 最后一次称赞他们是什么时候了？

sentences.english: Mitch complimented Beth on her new shoes.
History abounds with great men worthy of adulation and emulation.
sentences.chinese: 历史上有很多值得称赞和效法的伟人。

sentences.english: He has received so much public praise.
sentences.chinese: 他受到大家的交口称赞。

sentences.english: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand;
sentences.chinese: 愿他们口中称赞神为高，手里有两刃的刀。

sentences.english: So apt put an interviewer in a meliorate mood, attempt a praise.
sentences.chinese: 所以，给面试官一个好心情，说说称赞的话。

sentences.english: Many media coverage praised her as saving her infidelity, or just refused humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 很多报道称赞她，说她为守贞洁，宁死不辱。

sentences.english: Everybody spoke in praise of her devotion to the cause of education.
sentences.chinese: 大家异口同声地称赞她献身教育事业的精神。

sentences.english: It's for this grand theory of development that Piaget is much admired.
sentences.chinese: 因为这个重要的发展理论，皮亚杰受到了广泛地称赞。

sentences.english: All The Buddhas also praise this Dharma School.
She praised the government's decision not to deport the migrants.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞南非政府不驱逐这些移民的决定。

definition: to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
to give a thumbs-up/to express one's approval
